import React from 'react'; const Group3 = () => { return (
{/* Hero Section */}

Group 3

Journey through the Renaissance, classical music, and architectural marvels that define European heritage.

{/* Content Sections */}
{/* Historical Periods */}

Historical Periods

European history spans from ancient civilizations to modern nation-states, each period contributing to the continent's rich cultural tapestry.

  • • Ancient Greece: Democracy, philosophy, and classical art
  • • Roman Empire: Law, engineering, and imperial culture
  • • Middle Ages: Feudalism, chivalry, and Gothic architecture
  • • Renaissance: Humanism, art, and scientific discovery
{/* Art & Architecture */}

Art & Architecture

European art and architecture have influenced global aesthetics, from classical proportions to avant-garde movements that challenge traditional forms.

  • • Classical architecture: Greek temples and Roman monuments
  • • Gothic cathedrals: Soaring spires and stained glass
  • • Renaissance art: Perspective, humanism, and realism
  • • Modern movements: Impressionism, Cubism, and beyond
{/* Classical Music */}

Classical Music Heritage

European classical music tradition spans centuries, from medieval chants to contemporary compositions that continue to inspire worldwide.

  • • Baroque: Bach, Handel, and ornate musical forms
  • • Classical: Mozart, Haydn, and symphonic development
  • • Romantic: Beethoven, Chopin, and emotional expression
  • • Modern: Innovation and experimental compositions
{/* Literature & Philosophy */}

Literature & Philosophy

European literature and philosophy have shaped global thought, from ancient wisdom to modern existential questions and literary movements.

  • • Ancient philosophy: Socrates, Plato, and Aristotle
  • • Literary classics: Shakespeare, Dante, and Cervantes
  • • Enlightenment: Reason, liberty, and human rights
  • • Modern thought: Existentialism and postmodernism
{/* Cultural Traditions */}

Cultural Traditions

European cultural traditions reflect the continent's diversity, from Mediterranean warmth to Nordic resilience, each region contributing unique customs and celebrations.

Cuisine

Diverse regional specialties and traditions

Festivals

Seasonal celebrations and cultural events

Languages

Rich linguistic diversity and heritage
